meanings.definition: A unit of measure for the thickness of a typeface, equal to one-sixth of an em.
meanings.sent1: The designer adjusted the ecad to make the text more readable.
meanings.sent2: The printer selected a font with a specific ecad for the brochure.
meanings.sent3: The ecad of the font was so thin, it almost disappeared on the page.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting had an ecad as delicate as a spider's web.
meanings.sent5: The ecad of the typeface made the words look elegant and refined.
